alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 29 at 9:19PM CST until December 29 at 9:45PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Cherokee County in northeastern Alabama... * Until 945 PM CST. * At 919 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Moshat to near Ball Flat, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Centre, Forney, Pleasant Gap, Tennala, Moshat, Ball Flat, Eastern Weiss Lake, Coloma, Howells Crossroads, Waterhouse and Spring Garden. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for northeastern and east central Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 AM CST for east central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
